page.title: 09A FARM NEAR CROSSGATES
page.content: The{Shippen House Farm}was mentioned in the first{Domesday Book.}The farmer,{Mr.Marsden,}holds a{self {sufficient farming concern,}this includes 4 horses, 20 dairy cows, 5 calves for slaughter, 197 sheep,2 peahens and 1 peacock.The farm has{213 {acres}of land on which he grows potatoes, turnips, oats, barley, sugar beet soya meal. Most of the products he grows are used to feed the animals except the potatoes which he sells to the public. The cows produce 70 to 80 gallons of milk per day which he trades to the dairy. This farm is kept in good condition with the fields being sprayed twice a year. The sheep are kept in good health too by dipping them. In the winter the animals are placed in special housing to protect them from the frost.
